attributes.action: Make it illegal to smoke within 10 metres of a dwelling if it is hotter than 25C
attributes.background: In the summer, due to global warming, temperatures now regularly reach 30 - 35C. This is extremely hot and it is simply insulting to expect people to not open their windows because inconsiderate people are smoking outside their house.
attributes.additional_details:
I personally have been hugely affected by this issue. Smokers pollute the environment and contribute to global warming. They also severely harm others with second hand smoke, especially children. 
Children are often unable to play in the garden in the summer due to the noxious gases being emitted from the smoke, this causes a deficiency in vitamin D. This law will apply to all areas (public or residential) unless the owner of the properties affected allows them to smoke. Penalty: £400 - 6 months

attributes.action: Disallow Schools To Confiscate Mobile Phones
attributes.background: Schools should not be allowed to confiscate items such as mobile phones. Mobile Phone are necessary to a child's learning, it lets the student to enhance the internet, release stress, contacts friends for social support and let's parents and carers now where their child is and if they are ok.
attributes.additional_details: Yes, Phones can be a distraction meaning students must not use them in class but a teacher must not confiscate them. What are students suppose to do if they are in trouble walking home? What if they need to go to a friend's due to an emergency? What if the parent needs to contact the child but does not know where they are and who to ring?

attributes.action: Amend the Dog Act to include taking DNA of every dog to be kept with Microchip.
attributes.background: This was first suggested in July 2016 following a mixed breed Staffie mixed type dog nearly killing my Border Terrier. Only 66 people at that time signed it, so this time round it should get a better result.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the high number of dog attacks on sheep, and people as well as other canines, the aim is to have all dog owners and dog homes must have every dog’s DNA taken and registered on a database with their microchip. This would allow all dogs to be screened when attacks happen to find the owners.  Wounds can be swabbed and detection made, not only during injury investigation or th of sheep, but also for banned breeds!  
The DNA could also assist District Council to check samples of uncollected poo in order to trace owners and prosecute them.

attributes.action: Change the Yellow Box Junction Law to allow motorist to wait for upto 20 seconds
attributes.background:
The law is being misused by Local Councils as a business by installing more cameras and Yellow box junctions and generate millions by issuing tickets for few seconds.
A 20 second exemption should be given  to wait due to unavoidable circumstances and, also in the event no obstruction is caused.
attributes.additional_details: The intention of Honourable MPs for the Yellow Box junction law were not to generate money but to ensure smooth flow of traffic from the right in the event of heavy traffic on the main road. If the council were not stopped they will also convert KEEP CLEAR and T- Junctions into Yellow box junctions and will install CCTV to generate millions.

attributes.action: Erase CCJ immediately from records once debts are fully paid.
attributes.background: A CCJ on record for 6 years can be the end of normal life for most. 6 months career break alone is dangerous, 6 years is destructive. That Mortgages will be lost, homes break under financial burden, people look to emigrate over a £300 registered debt is ludicrous & the judgements too easily applied.

attributes.action: Make booking fees illegal where tickets are only available from one vendor
attributes.background: Ticketing websites regularly charge customers the added cost of a booking fee when using their services despite it often being only website on which tickets are available. This enables vendors to charge whatever price they want knowing if people want the tickets they must pay the charge.
attributes.additional_details: When using sites such as Ticketmaster there is the added cost of a booking fee with the purchase of tickets. In many cases the ticket is only available from this website allowing a monopoly over their sale, this in turn leaves customers open to exploitation as vendors can charge excessive booking fees under this monopoly. Under this proposal booking fees would be banned unless tickets for the same event were on sale elsewhere creating competition among ticket vendors to offer the best price.

attributes.action: The penalty for using a mobile phone while driving  1year ban and £500 fine.
attributes.background: Too many people are being injured and killed on our roads the present penalties are not a deterrent. Too many people are ignoring the issue.

attributes.action: Minimum sentences for using physical violence or brandishing weapons.
attributes.background: On a regular basis my colleagues and I are subjected to physical aggression and attacked in the course of our lawful duty. We want minimum custodial sentences brought in so when we are attacked in our workplace or have weapons brandished against us we will have confidence in the justice system.
attributes.additional_details:
On 3 seperate occasions I personally have had knives pulled on me during the execution of warrants issued by HMCTS. On 2 occasions the police refused to arrest as they said there is no point and on the 1 occasion they did the offended was issued a £50.00 fine (which they never paid) with no other punishment at all. 

This is a story that is all too common in our workplace and I feel a minimum sentence should be introduced to provide justice to all frontline workers attacked or threatened.

attributes.action: End PFI in the NHS
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, are disappointed that the Prime Minister has not ruled out the possibility of US companies having any involvement in the NHS as part of a post-Brexit trade deal with the USA.
attributes.additional_details:
We are concerned that allowing such involvement will lock the British taxpayer into long-term debt, especially should any NHS trust involved require additional funding.

We are further concerned that the needs of private financiers and banks will dictate the shape, size and scale of our health services and that the high costs of PFI debt charges means that the NHS will be unable to operate as it would have done through conventional procurement funding.

We therefore call upon the British Government not only to rule out US or any other foreign company involvement in the NHS post-Brexit but to commit to no extension to or further PFI funding arrangements across all NHS services.

attributes.action: Increased sentences for assaulting a police officer.
attributes.background: The police do a difficult and quite often thankless job in order to keep our communities safe, all too often this can be a very dangerous job.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the sentence for assaulting a police officer ranges from a from a fine to a maximum of 6 months in prison. 

Recently a police officer in the West Midlands police was assaulted and had a large chunk of hair ripped from her head whilst attending a domestic incident, her attacker received a paltry 12 weeks suspended sentence. 
https://www.itv.com/news/central/2018-01-12/police-woman-has-hair-ripped-out-after-being-assaulted-on-shift/ 

This kind of lenient sentencing will only serve to demoralise the police when they should be given full support from the courts. I therefore propose that a minimum custodial sentence of 18 months be introduced for any assault on a police officer.

attributes.action: Buy British made Mechanised Infantry Vehicles for the army
attributes.background: Britain currently has a major trade deficit, especially in manufactured goods. the country's engineering capability and capacity has been severely degraded over the past thirty years, in part because of successive refusals by the British government to support and encourage manufacturing in Britain.

attributes.action: Make 'traffic light' food/drink labelling legally compulsory in the UK.
attributes.background:
One often reads, hears or sees in the news these days that obesity levels in the UK
have reached pandemic proportions,
leading to concerns about the risk of heart disease and diabetes, among other serious and life-changing illnesses.
attributes.additional_details: A big contributing factor is the amount of excess fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar consumed by the average UK citizen on a daily basis. There is a clear system available called the "traffic lights", whereby food and drink items can be rated using red (high), amber (medium) and green (low) images to simply and clearly indicate how much fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar are contained in 100 grams or 100 millilitres of an item. As I understand it use of the traffic lights is currently voluntary.

attributes.action: Keep accepting credit card payments for all tax payments
attributes.background: The Government are stopping accepting credit card payments from 13th January 2018 - please sign to keep the acceptance of credit card payments after this date.
attributes.additional_details: Small business owner

attributes.action: Armed Forces Veterans should be entitled to concessionary rail travel.
attributes.background: Should have the same entitlement to discounted rail travel as serving members.
attributes.additional_details: As a Royal Navy veteran (23 years under the waves) I feel it unfair that there is no mechanism in place to obtain a railcard other than the normal route, ie Family & Friends, Disability, 16-25 or wait until I reach 60. Serving our country is an honour and requires a massive commitment for many years, so I do not feel it is too much to ask for a small token to help with travel costs, especially when none of the other cards are valid for the lone, uninjured, pre-State Pension Veteran traveller.

attributes.action: Invest in gridscale battery storage to stabilise wholesale prices of electricity
attributes.background: Renewable energy supply has succeeded in droping wholesale MW prices into negative but without storage nothing is being done to prevent low supply periods seeing prices hikes as high as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. A stable grid, means cheaper bills for consumers and a future for energy suppliers
attributes.additional_details: On 11th June 2017 a record 70% of the electricity for the UK’s homes and businesses was low-carbon. Solar cuts the power demand for National Grid, reducing prices, while wind power also lowers prices. When renewable supply drops however wholesale prices are being ramped higher. Prices can fluctuate between less than £0 and as much as £83 per MW as seen in May 2017. Battery storage facilities like the new plant seen in South East Australia would resolve this problem and save the consumer money.

attributes.action: Raise the Help to Buy ISA qualifying limit to £300k to match Stamp Duty policy.
attributes.background: It was recently announced that Stamp Duty was abolished for first time buyers on properties up to £300,000. However, Help to Buy ISA’s only qualify for the bonus on properties up to £250,000. I feel this qualifying limit should be raised to £300,000 to be in line with the new Stamp Duty.

attributes.action: Amend the Dangerous Wild Animals Act to Exotic and Dangerous Wild Animals Act
attributes.background: Amend the DWA, making it a legal obligation to possess a license for ownership of any wild or non-native species; preventing whimsical buying of animals with specialist care needs to safeguard animal welfare.
attributes.additional_details: Buying without researching care needs of specific animals is especially damaging to reptiles which suffer from ailments, like metabolic bone disease, as a result of improper husbandry. Introducing a license for exotic pet ownership should encourage people buying to understand the commitment they are undertaking, particularly if paired with expert consultation at the time of license purchase. The "EDWA" should also aim to hold accountable those involved in crimes against the Animal Welfare Act.

attributes.action: Make the Monday after Remembrance Sunday a bank holiday.
attributes.background: A lot of people like to travel to the Remembrance Sunday parades. Many of these people are ex-service personnel now working for civilian companies, having the Monday off would allow them to travel to London for example or where they spent much of their service life such as Portsmouth & Plymouth
attributes.additional_details: for the Navy and Aldershot for the Army. They would be able to travel with their families and meet with old comrades and the people who are serving now so they can share memories and stories of old friends who are no longer with us and the places they have been and things they have seen.

attributes.action: Abolish Stamp Duty on Homes under £300000 for all buyers
attributes.background: Why only abolish stamp duty on houses under £300000 for first time buyers as a lot of families moving home would benefit from this too. Most first time buyers won’t benefit as much as families upsizing their house and the saving would incentify buying

attributes.action: Reduce the tax on cigarettes and return cigarettes to old packaging
attributes.background: I don't think I need to explain the price hikes that have gone on in recent years on cigarettes, but the announcement of Phillip Hammond wanting to Raise prices again is a step to far, I suggest in this petition to remove all pre tax on cigarettes so they are just the 20% sales tax as standard
attributes.additional_details: Akin to this is the packaging rule which has caused problems throughout UK supermarkets of tellers handing customers wrong brands then refusing exchanges, is there any evidence that this reduces smoking in youth? Because I have seen no difference

attributes.action: Establish an independent board that investigates complaints against the Police
attributes.background: After our own personal experiences of accessing the Police Complaints System we soon realised it is not fit for purpose.  We  represent a large number of victims  and all of those who have made a complaint to the Police have either not had their complaint investigated or had a satisfactory outcome.
attributes.additional_details: Presently the Police investigate themselves and this is obvious it is open to misconduct.  We and our victims we represent have complained to the IPCC on numerous occasions and they will not investigate the Police often sending the complaint straight back to the Professional Standards Department.  We want a Police Complaints system totally independent to the Police made up of members trained in Law and with civilian oversight and a number of victims of crime on the panel.

attributes.action: Make all cyclists wear helmets and have insurance cover a legal requirement.
attributes.background: All cyclists should have to wear an approved standard helmet to reduce head injury if they come off their bikes.  They should also have to have insurance cover in case they damage, injure a third party or other vehicle. As at present there is no easy method to get a cyclist to pay for damage caused.
attributes.additional_details: Cyclist need to be protected from themselves in the same way that drivers were protected from themselves by the introduction of safety laws  (wearing seat belts). This would reduce deaths and the cost of health care levied on the NHS.  Cyclist should have insurance cover to ride on the road so if they inadvertently cause damage to another vehicle or person, then that person or vehicle damaged will have a simple method of recovering damages without having to go through a costly legal process.

attributes.action: Provide a 9-1 GCSE Law syllabus and encourage examination boards to follow it.
attributes.background: GCSE law is a great qualification as it allows students who do not have the knowledge to perform at a-level to show their ability in another way. Sadly, all the exam boards that provide the subject will scrap it in 2018. This petition calls on the government to provide a syllabus after that.
attributes.additional_details:
"GCSE Law helps students to develop skills of selection, analysis, critical thinking and decision making, and builds an awareness of the rights and responsibilities of individuals" AQA
Without this subject, we risk causing a lack of knowledge around students who no longer have any reason to study law at 16. All the exam boards... Namely OCR and AQA plan to abolish the subject! http://www.aqa.org.uk/subjects/law/gcse/law-4160
http://www.ocr.org.uk/qualifications/gcse-law-j485-from-2012/

attributes.action: Make government condemn the violence of Spain's police against the Catalans
attributes.background: On the day of the Catalonia independence referendum, Spain's national police used batons and rubber bullets to attack people who were peacefully attempting to cast their vote. Approximately 890 Catalans were injured. Let's make our government stand against brutalising peaceful voters.
attributes.additional_details: The response to a peaceful referendum should never be violence, especially not by the police force that should serve and protect the Catalans. The UK foreign ministry has refused to condemn the Spanish authorities. This is unacceptable to me. I therefore would like to express that I and my fellow citizens do condemn the heinous violence of Spain's national police towards their citizens . Hopefully we will be heard.

attributes.action: Make Single File riding compulsory for cyclists.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, respectfully call on the Transport Minister to implement Compulsory Single File for all cyclists who ride in groups,  regardless of whether a bike lane exists or not..
attributes.additional_details:
We are tired of seeing cyclists continue to ride two or more abreast, spilling into traffic and impeding traffic flow.

We are tired of the safety hazards such cyclists present. We believe no other safety initiative will deliver better results than compelling cyclists to ride Single File.  indeed, every text book on the subject of Risk Management says that “isolating a hazard” is a superior solution to changing the way people operate. A bike lane is an example of “Isolating the Hazard”.

attributes.action: Allow police to confiscate mobile phones when drivers are caught using them.
attributes.background: Fining drivers for mobile phone use appears to be of little deterrent on its own. A fine along with points on the license and immediate confiscation could possibly have more impact. The inconvenience and cost of losing all personal contacts and data would, for some people, be immeasurable.
attributes.additional_details: Lincolnshire recently had a blitz on catching drivers using mobile phones, as far as I can see that made absolutely no difference. I see the same people day in day out driving while using hand held mobile phones, that includes tractor drivers.

attributes.action: Make Transverse Myelitis recognisable on all life and health insurance policies!
attributes.background: Transverse myelitis is the sister illness to MS! However is unrecognised in mainstream private health and life insurance policies! Which means I can’t protect my family if something happened to me! Please sign the petition to make it a legal requirement to add this illness to the list! Thank you.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for security staff to have a body-worn camera.
attributes.background: Due to the nature of some security staff otherwise known as 'bouncers', it has become clear to me that a body worn camera is needed for the safety and security of both parties.
attributes.additional_details: Everyone who has been to an event of some kind knows of one or more stories of something going wrong when trying to get into the event. If evidence such as video can be reviewed then a better outcome can come of the incident.

attributes.action: Have GMT all year round.
attributes.background:
An extra hour in bed every day for six months of the year.

The correct time for our longitude.

attributes.action: Lower the legal sex age to 15 years of age.
attributes.background: The president of the Faculty of Public Health, said the current legal limit prevented sexually active younger teenagers from getting support with issues of disease and contraception with official figures indicating that as many as a third of all 15 year olds are having sex in the UK.
attributes.additional_details: It would also make it easier for 15 year olds who are already having sex to obtain contraception or sexual health advice from the NHS.

attributes.action: Do not impose same-sex marriage on religious minorities
attributes.background: We call on Parliament, now and in the future, to continue to uphold the fundamental human right of religious minorities (Christians, Muslims, Jews and others) not to have same-sex marriage imposed on us, as guaranteed by the so-called ‘quadruple lock’ in the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013.
attributes.additional_details:
The right of religious minorities not to have same-sex marriage imposed on them was guaranteed by the so-called ‘quadruple lock’ which was included in the Marriage (Same Sex Couples) Act 2013 when same-sex marriage was legalized in the UK.

We call on Parliament to continue to uphold and respect this fundamental human right.

We remind Parliament that one of its key functions in a democratic society is to protect minorities from the ‘tyranny of the majority.’

attributes.action: Reinstate Part 2 of the Leveson Inquiry
attributes.background: The Government has cancelled the second part of the Leveson Inquiry into the scale of potentially unlawful behaviour by the Press and Police during the phone hacking scandal.
attributes.additional_details: The public deserves to know of any collaboration involved and any identified offenders should be brought to justice.

attributes.action: Make two modest but sensible precautions in case Brexit goes badly.
attributes.background:
Precaution 1.  Hold a post-Brexit referendum on whether to return to the EU.  

Precaution 2.  Ensure our Brexit Terms include the right for a "fast-track" return of the UK to the EU, ideally under pre-Brexit conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
If that new shirt doesn’t quite fit, we can return it to the shop.  To make sure we don’t lose those precious family photos, we back-up the laptop from time to time. 

So if rights-of-return and back-up plans make sense for an individual, shouldn't a nation of 65 million people have a contingency plan just in case Brexit is not the resounding success we all hope for?

No-one on either side of the argument has a crystal ball, so can we afford not to have an insurance policy in our back pocket?

attributes.action: Police officers should be allowed spit hoods as part of their kit.
attributes.background: At the moment police officers can only use a spit hood in the custody footprint ie in the yard, cage or in custody. Imagine having to do a hospital guard for 8 hours with someone spitting at you and constantly threatening to spit at you.
attributes.additional_details: There are significant health risks through spitting a Ukrainian police officer contracted tuberculosis in 2016 and died. You are also at risk of hep b and hep c as well as cold and flu viruses.

attributes.action: Have a UK passport only channel in U.K. airports.
attributes.background:
Every time I fly throughout the year I am constantly in a huge queue to enter my home country!
It is so frustrating to have a UK/EU passport channel where 75% of the people are not UK citizens. We are one of the only countries where our own citizens queue to come HOME.
attributes.additional_details:
We shouldn’t have to be in a long queue where most of those are EU not U.K. citizens. Priority should be given to British passport holders just as every other country does by having U.K. passport ONLY lanes too.
Even the queues for non EU/UK passports is often smaller and quicker and it’s really a kick in the teeth to queue when in other counties airports at the border and then also at the border when you get home!

attributes.action: Give fathers automatic parental responsibility
attributes.background:
Mothers get automatic parental responsibility for a child but fathers do not
Fathers are not second class citizens and fathers helped create the child as much as the mother did

 it feels very sexist and discriminative against fathers

attributes.action: Make the National Speed Limit 80mph.
attributes.background: The motor way is used by drivers to get to further destinations quickly. Having a speed limit is already limiting its use and having an abundance of speed cameras is further limiting it. Making the NSL 80mph will at least contribute to a quicker journey time amongst all these other limitations.
attributes.additional_details:
More car accidents are had on regular roads.
Speed cameras are on many roads where crashes aren't even a problem. 
Amongst restricted parking, restricted roads and roads being flooded with traffic lights, traffic is a problem. Speed cameras further increase this as people slow down just for these cameras.

attributes.action: Cyclists to wear mandatory cycling helmet, high viz vest and front light.
attributes.background: A lack of legislation to cyclists poses risk to pedestrians and to other road users due to their lack of visibility. The government should pass a legislation for mandatory wear of cycling helmet, high visibility vest and a front regulated light permanently switched-on at all time while cycling.

attributes.action: Remove police cautions from criminal records after 10 years.
attributes.background: A lot of people have accepted a police caution in the past after being told by the police that it isn't the same as a criminal conviction and it wont appear on their criminal record, only to find many years later that it appears on advanced criminal record checks affecting their ability to work.

attributes.action: Keep the Panavia Tornado in service for another few years
attributes.background: The Tornado is one of the most capable and advanced strike aircraft currently fielded by any air force today, and RAF Tornados are currently conducting airstrikes on insurgents in the Middle East, and the Tornado will be kept in service by Germany until 2025, so why can’t we?

attributes.action: Fund research into Granuloma Annulare
attributes.background: Granuloma Annulare is a skin condition which causes an unsightly rash and severe itching and there is no known cure for it.
attributes.additional_details: I run a Facebook page for this condition and have hundreds of members all who are getting nowhere in the UK when they go to see a dermatologist. This needs to change.

attributes.action: Stop charging for Vehicle Excise Duty
attributes.background:
The government wastes taxpayer money by collecting vehicle excise duty in the form of a tax on the car.
Instead the revenue currently generated through VED could be collected by adding a fraction of a pence to every litre of fuel sold.
attributes.additional_details:
Every year £100 million worth of VED goes unpaid through evasion.
Car insurance and MOT details are now held on a central register so the outdated requirement to provide these documents when taxing a car is un-necesaary. 
VED could be collected by adding a fraction of a pence to every litre of fuel sold, this would create a simple and unavoidable way of collecting the revenue. It would also encourage people to buy fuel efficient cars therefore helping the environment.

attributes.action: Ban all stand alone ATM’s
attributes.background: Everyday the news and social media are reporting on the increasing crime of Ram Raids on shops for the stand alone cash machines (ATM). Some of these shops have been targeted more than once. This has to stop, and the only way we can help, is to have the stand alone machines removed from shops now.
attributes.additional_details: The Police can only advise shopkeepers on security and not enforce it, and the stand alone ATM’s do not have trackers fitted or ‘Smart’ Water. I am asking for these cash machines to be removed from shops, and the initial temptation for these criminals will also be removed. Livelihoods, jobs, are all disrupted. Bank / Post office branch cash machines are better installed and are rarely raided, we live in a world where we pay for things via apps, so cash is not that essential.

attributes.action: End institutional care for children: orphanages and children's homes
attributes.background: Over 55% of those in the care system end up in the prison system, are vulnerable for human trafficking, prostitution, drugs, alcohol abuse and teenage pregnancy, plus, 40% of care leavers are not in education, employment or training at age 19 compared to 11% of the general population.
attributes.additional_details: 75% of children in care live in Foster Homes costing the Country £1.5 Billion, however, 25% of children in care who live in Children's Homes costs the Country £1 Billion (2012-2013) on average £133,000 - £148,000 per child per year, yet it will cost a parent approximately £25,000 - £30,000 per year to send their child to a top boarding school to receive the best education money can buy, and those that attend boarding school don’t end up in prison. This is one of many viable solutions to consider

attributes.action: Fund higher-level classes for profoundly gifted GCSE students
attributes.background: Many highly intelligent pupils feel abandoned by their secondary schools in the UK. Their ability to work and absorb new information at faster rate results in the majority of their time in school being unproductive, wasting time that should be spent realising their potential in academia.

attributes.action: abolish the housing benefit cap to stop families with children living in poverty
attributes.background: over 400,000 will be living in poverty because of the housing benefits rules this must end to give those affected a chance of living a life without the worry about not having money to give there kids a better life

attributes.action: Create a ‘Residential Care Voucher’ scheme
attributes.background: As a parent to a young child, I can take advantage of the tax-efficient way to pay towards her childcare. I propose a similar scheme be set up so that people can save towards the often unmanageable costs surrounding residential care for elderly loved ones.
attributes.additional_details:
A scheme should exist where:
Employees can pay into a ‘pot’ that is dedicated to the residential / end-of-life care of loved ones.
Monies saved are protected by a government-backed scheme (similar to savings at the bank)
Savings to the employee are present through salary-sacrifice
Monies deposited  are available should they become not necessary
People can chose to pay into their own account and/or an account for a relative/friend 

The scheme should mirror the current childcare voucher scheme

attributes.action: Make the purchase of fireworks without a permit & I.D illegal.
attributes.background: The number of emergency calls received by police relating to fireworks & their misuse could be reduced if retailers recorded who they sell to & require the buyer to present a firework permit issued in a similar way that a person may apply for a private event permit meaning less antisocial behaviour
attributes.additional_details:
If you have ever called the police because fireworks are being used in dangerous ways you may have been told its not a priority despite a firework being able to cause major injuries, with a permit and ID required to purchase fireworks less youths will be able to purchase fireworks, to reinforce this 
All retailers should record the details of who bought the fireworks, when, how many of which type. In doing so it will be easy to identify law abiding retailers by checking sales records and stock

attributes.action: Scrap driving theory test
attributes.background: The theory test is a waste of time, effort and most importantly money. I think it should be removed for good.

attributes.action: Ban horse racing
attributes.background: Horses are whipped and forced to run around tracks that are often made of hard-packed dirt at speeds of more than 30 miles per hour while carrying people on their backs. Racehorses are the victims of a multibillion-dollar industry that has problems with drug abuse, injuries and race fixing.
attributes.additional_details: When they stop winning races or become injured, some owners don’t want to pay for a horse who doesn’t bring in any money. Many end up in slaughterhouses where they are turned into dog food and glue. They may endure days of transport in tiny trailers where there is no access to water, food and injuries are common. Horses tend to thrash about in order to avoid being shot by the gun, which is supposed to render them unconscious before their throats are cut.
